intro: Pilea lomatogramma, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically round or heart-shaped. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Pilea lomatogramma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
